name: Smart hysteresis threshold
description:
Combination of 3 thresholds (2 if checkSurelyBackground is false) and "Smart dilating objects".
Lets A = "surely" (pixels that surely belong to the objects): surelyMin ≤ intensity ≤surelyMax.
Let B = "maybe" (pixels with less probability to be objects): hysteresisMin ≤ intensity ≤ hysteresisMax.
And let C = "unlikely" (pixels, that are surely not background); for bacgkround (NOT C) we have surelyBackgroundMin ≤ intensity ≤surelyBackgroundMax. (You may use more understandable values, if you set "Invert background" flag; in this case, C is the set of pixels where surelyBackgroundMin ≤ intensity ≤surelyBackgroundMax.)
 
We find H (hysteresis): objects on B connected with A. Then we find R = (dilation of A AND H: pixels in H not too far from A. Then, if "Check surely background" flag is set, we replace R = R AND (dilation of NOT C): pixels in R that are close enough to sure background. The we return R = R OR A.

controls.name: surelyMin
controls.hint: If not set (an empty string), it is considered to be −∞ (not checked).

controls.hint: If not set (an empty string), it is considered to be +∞ (not checked).

controls.hint: If not set (an empty string), it is considered to be −∞ (not checked).

controls.name: hysteresisMax
controls.hint: If not set (an empty string), it is considered to be +∞ (not checked).

controls.name: checkSurelyBackground
controls.caption: Check surely background
controls.description: Checking background flag: if false, all parameters containing "background" word will be ignored

controls.name: surelyBackgroundMin

controls.name: surelyBackgroundMax
controls.hint: If not set (an empty string), it is considered to be +∞ (not checked).

controls.name: invertBackground
controls.caption: Invert background
controls.description: Invert background flag: if true, then surelyBackgroundMin ≤ intensity ≤ surelyBackgroundMax NOT for background, but for set C (see description of the function)

controls.name: rawValues
controls.caption: Raw values
controls.description: If set, all min/max values above are "raw" (not normalized): these values are used as-is. If cleared, they should be normalized values in 0..1 range.
